summary: This is an email from an unknown sender to an unknown recipient, likely discussing legal strategy regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The sender relays that Epstein has rejected a proposal and asks when they will indict, while the recipient indicates the situation is more complicated.

events.title: Email discussing Epstein indictment status
events.description: An email is sent discussing that Jeffrey Epstein has rejected a proposal, prompting questions about when an indictment will occur, with the response that the situation is complicated.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 6, 2007, and discusses legal strategy regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
Epstein is stated to have rejected a proposal, leading to questions about when an indictment will occur.
The recipient indicates the situation is 'a tad more complicated' than simply moving to indict.
The email suggests ongoing legal negotiations or discussions prior to a potential indictment of Epstein.
